translation: This Self cannot be cut, burned, wetted, nor dried up; it is eternal, all-pervasive, stable, immovable, and ancient.
commentary: 2.24 Achedyaḥ cannot be cut? Ayam this (Self)? Adahyah cannot be burnt? This is this? Akledyah cannot be wetted? Ashoshyaḥ cannot be died? Eve also? f and? Eternal eternal? omnipresent allpervading? stable: stable? immovable immovable? This is this? Sanatanah ancient.Commentary The Self is very subtle. It is beyond the reach of speech and mind. It is very difficult to understand this subtle Self. So Lord Krishna explains
